title: scanorama
description: Use Scanorama to integrate different experiments.

obs_batch.description: Column name discriminating between your batches.

obsm_input.description: Basis obsm slot to run scanorama on.

obsm_output.description: The name of the field in adata.obsm where the integrated embeddings will be stored after running this function. Defaults to X_scanorama.

knn.description: Number of nearest neighbors to use for matching.

batch_size.description: The batch size used in the alignment vector computation. Useful when integrating very large (>100k samples) datasets. Set to large value that runs within available memory.

sigma.description: Correction smoothing parameter on Gaussian kernel.

approx.description: Use approximate nearest neighbors with Python annoy; greatly speeds up matching runtime.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

param_list.description:
Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. Possible formats are csv, json, yaml, or simply a yaml_blob.
A csv should have column names which correspond to the different arguments of this pipeline.
A json or a yaml file should be a list of maps, each of which has keys corresponding to the arguments of the pipeline.
A yaml blob can also be passed directly as a parameter.
Inside the Nextflow pipeline code, params.params_list can also be used to directly a list of parameter sets.
When passing a csv, json or yaml, relative path names are relativized to the location of the parameter file.

param_list_format.description: Manually specify the param_list_format. Must be one of 'csv', 'json', 'yaml', 'yaml_blob', 'asis' or 'none'.
